page.title: 19THE LEE MOOR BY-PASS ROAD.
page.content: To enable the reserves of china clay to be extracted,which are to the east of Lee Moor village,a new road had to be constructed.This new section of road stretches from Tolchmoor Gate to Wotter.As well as being routed clear of the china clay deposits,it also by-passes Wotter and Lee Moor villages.With the completion of this road the original Cornwood to Cadover Bridge road,which crosses the area of extraction,has been closed.Now there is no road which goes right through Lee Moor village,the only access being from the new road.The same applies to Wotter village,the edge of which is within the grid.
